# NSPointerFunctions.Options

**Structure**

Defines the memory and personality options for an `NSPointerFunctions` object.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Options
```

## Overview

When specifying a value, you can use only one of the options listed in Memory Options,  only one of the options listed in Personality Options, and any number of other options.

## Memory Options

- **machVirtualMemory**: Use Mach memory.
- **mallocMemory**: Use `free()` on removal, `calloc()` on copy in.
- **opaqueMemory**: Take no action when pointers are deleted.
- **strongMemory**: Use strong write-barriers to backing store; use garbage-collected memory on copy-in.
- **weakMemory**: Uses weak read and write barriers appropriate for ARC or GC. Using NSPointerFunctionsWeakMemory object references will turn to `NULL` on last release.
- **NSMapTableStrongMemory**: Equivalent to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/Options/strongMemory].
- **NSMapTableWeakMemory**: Equivalent to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/Options/weakMemory].

## Personality Options

- **cStringPersonality**: Use a string hash and `strcmp`; C-string ‘`%s`’ style description.
- **integerPersonality**: Use unshifted value as hash and equality.
- **objectPersonality**: Use `hash` and `isEqual` methods for hashing and equality comparisons, use the `description` method for a description.
- **objectPointerPersonality**: Use shifted pointer for the hash value and direct comparison to determine equality; use the `description` method for a description.
- **opaquePersonality**: Use shifted pointer for the hash value and direct comparison to determine equality.
- **structPersonality**: Use a memory hash and `memcmp` (using a size function that you must set—see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/sizeFunction]).
- **NSMapTableObjectPointerPersonality**: Equivalent to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/Options/objectPointerPersonality].

## Copy Option

- **copyIn**: Use the memory acquire function to allocate and copy items on input (see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/acquireFunction]).
- **NSMapTableCopyIn**: Equivalent to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSPointerFunctions/Options/copyIn].

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
